definitions.text: to move in a twisting or contorted motion, (especially when struggling)
examples: The prisoner writhed in discomfort
The child tried to wriggle free from his aunt's embrace

definitions.text: cause (a plastic object) to assume a crooked or angular form
examples: bend the rod
twist the dough into a braid
the strong man could turn an iron bar
twist one's head
The cord is all twisted
Twist the strips of dough
The road winds around the lake
the path twisted through the forest

definitions.text: twist or pull violently or suddenly, especially so as to remove (something) from that to which it is attached or from where it originates
examples: wrench a window off its hinges
wrench oneself free from somebody's grip
a deep sigh was wrenched from his chest

definitions.text: practice sophistry; change the meaning of or be vague about in order to mislead or deceive
examples: Don't twist my words

definitions.text: twist suddenly so as to sprain
examples: wrench one's ankle
The wrestler twisted his shoulder
the hikers sprained their ankles when they fell
I turned my ankle and couldn't walk for several days

definitions.text: having an intended meaning altered or misrepresented
examples: many of the facts seemed twisted out of any semblance to reality
a perverted translation of the poem
